page.title: 17EDUCATION:HISTORY:DUNDONALD
page.content: There is only one school in the village of Dundonald and this is the local Primary school. The history of the school goes back a long way. In fact,the school was first mentioned in the Minutes of the Church Session on 9th June,1605 but there was no proper school building until around 1634 when a school building was put up in the churchyard and the school was known as the Parish School. The school was housed in this building until the beginning of the 19th century when it was knocked down and a new one built, again close to the church. This building is no longer the school but is still in use as a Community Centre and is called the Montgomerie Hall. The present school building was built in 1897 and has been added to at various times as the need arose.
